document.docTitle: Pseudopoda rivicola Jäger & Vedel, 2007, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Sparassidae of China 4. The genus Pseudopoda (Araneae: Sparassidae) in Yunnan Province

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Sparassidae of China 4. The genus Pseudopoda (Araneae: Sparassidae) in Yunnan Province

subSubSection.paragraph:

male (PJ 1905 ), Dali, Cangshan, riverside of stream, leaf litter (Fig. 192 ), 2200– 2400 m [

6 April 1999
, P. Jäger, ( SMF ).

1 male
(PJ 1811 ), Emei, Emei Shan, river below cableway valley station to Wannian temple, under stones, 750 m ,
22 March 1999
[
29 ° 34 ' 43 "N
,
103 ° 24 ' 58 "E
], P. Jäger ( SMF ). ( note: structures of male and female copulatory openings in subadult specimens were recognisable after removing the penultimate moult. These structures and colouration point clearly to conspecifity with the holotype ).

Etymology. The specific name is derived from the Latin words ‘rivus’, meaning ‘stream, little river’, and ‘colere’, meaning, among others, ‘to inhabit, to live in’. The name refers to the apparent preference of this species for damp sites close to streams or other moist places; adjective.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 97–104.
Pseudopoda rivicola
sp. n. from Cangshan, Dali (97–99 holotype male, PJ 1905; 100–104 paratype female, PJ 1904). 97–99 Left male palp (97 prolateral; 98 ventral; 99 retrolateral); 100 Epigyne, ventral; 101 Vulva, dorsal; 102 Schematic course of internal duct system, dorsal; 103 Prosoma, dorsal; 104 Sternum, ventral.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation. Colouration is darker and more distinct in some specimens, dorsal OS may be dark also in its anterior half, ventral OS may be darker, especially in its posterior half.
